hook.text: Imagine money that no government controls. No bank can freeze it. No one can print more.

buildup.text: In 2008, someone called Satoshi Nakamoto had a wild idea: money powered by math, not banks.

discovery.text: Computers compete to solve puzzles. Winners get new coins. This is called mining.

twist.text: Only 21 million Bitcoin will ever exist. That's it. Forever. Like digital gold with a fixed supply.

climax.text: Your coins live on the blockchain. Only you have the key. Not even Bitcoin's creator can take them.

punchline.text: Bitcoin: the world's first money that nobody owns, but everybody can use.

quiz.question: Why is Bitcoin compared to gold?
options: It has a limited supply that can't be increased
